title: Lab-10a Cloudinary Setup
objectives: Sign up and configure a Cloudinary Account.

chapters.title: # Objectives
chapters.contentMd:
# Objectives

Sign up and configure a Cloudinary Account.

chapters.title: # Signup
chapters.contentMd: # Signup Visit this site: - cloudinary.com And sign up for a free account on the free plan. Be sure to verify your email address, as your account will be suspended if it is not confirmed within a day or so. During sign up, you will be offered a 'Cloudinary cloud name' - you can accept the default one or try to claim one. When you are logged in visit the 'Settings' screen. Your Cloudinary name will be visible on the 'Account' screen: ![](img/01.png) On the 'Security' panel, scroll to the end and take note of the `Access Keys' (blacked out here): ![](img/02.png) The `API Secret' normally displays as asterisks. If you click on them, the actual code will be revealed. **Note:** This information is also available on the `Dashboard`. ![](img/05.png)

chapters.title: # Exploring Cloudinary
chapters.contentMd:
# Exploring Cloudinary

Visit the Media Library page:

![](img/06.png)

Experiment with uploading a picture by dragging and dropping an image to the upload area.

Once uploaded, double click on the image and look at the various options:

![](img/04.png)

Note the url on the bottom right - this is a public url for the uploaded image. If you click on it, it will load.  You can share this link publicly.

chapters.title: # Exercises
chapters.contentMd:
# Exercises

Have a look around some of the other features of the site - particularly the 'Reports' and 'Transformations'. Then proceed to the next lab, which will explore the Cloudinary API.
